instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is 3V3_S0SW_LCD? 3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. This is necessary to get an image on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
This device came through for a 'FlexGate' repair however when we have checked the lcd connector J8500 we're missing all the EDP lines.. I've not yet come across a device with all the EDP lines missing so not sure if this is game over as the <SIGNAL>EDP_ML</SIGNAL> lines show value but the cpu is showing heat in some areas.

We have the following values in diode mode and voltage for lcd pins:

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 0.542 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 0. 541 0v

<SIGNAL>BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 0.528
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> 0.528
<SIGNAL>LCD_IRQ_L</SIGNAL> = 0.529

<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_P</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><0> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><0> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><1> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><1> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><2> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><2> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><3> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><3> = 0

<SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_C_N</SIGNAL> = 0.241
<SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_C_P</SIGNAL> = 0.242
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><0> = 0.244
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><0> = 0.243
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><1> = 0.242
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><1> = 0.245
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><2> = 0.243
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><2> = 0.245
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><3> = 0.242
<SIGNAL>EDP_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><3> = 0.242

Any help is much appreciated! Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
Check continuity from <CHIP>U8510</CHIP> to J8500.
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>  is high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 3v3 and steady
We have continuity from <CHIP>U8510</CHIP> and J8500

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 0.528"
What is the voltage there?
If 0V, then change <CHIP>U8510</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message: Then <SIGNAL>PANEL_P3V3_EN_DLY</SIGNAL> should be high too; confirm that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
Then you should have 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>.
If not, check <CHIP>U8500</CHIP>/1 voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message: I have re-tested and I do have correct voltages for 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message: Then check <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> voltage again; it should be high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
You should have image at least; missing backlight only?

Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
Yes I tested with a known good screen and tested this screen on another board..

I still don't have any of the EDP INT values

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message: I hope you've checked <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> level with LCD connetced...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
yes <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> was checked with screen connected. The EDP INT lines missing are the ones below which were checked in diode mode both with and without screen connected:

<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_P</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><0> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><0> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><1> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><1> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><2> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><2> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><3> = 0
<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><3> = 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Display
threads.message:
This board has series capacitors on the <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> lines; no reason to check there.
If you want to make an idea, then check on the left side of <CAPACITOR>C8520</CAPACITOR>-9.

If T-CON board receives <SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, then should send back to MLB high level on <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>.
Then PCH starts the communication with T-CON.
